name: Frozen Mezcal Palomas
description: This is a summer cocktail you won't soon forget. It's bright and tart like a margarita, but not too sweet, and the soft, floral side of grapefruit comes forward, along with perfectly balanced bitterness. The key here, though, is the base spirit. You may think of mezcal as smoky, but the smoke from roasted agave is just a whisper in this cocktail, alongside savory, olive oil–like flavors, allowed to shine with help from a bit of salt.
totalTime: 4 hours 5 minutes (or up to 10 hours 5 minutes)
recipeIngredient: 4 ounces (120ml) fresh juice from 1 to 2 pink grapefruits
Lime wheel, sliced in half crosswise, for garnish (optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Add grapefruit juice, lime juice, honey, mezcal, and salt to a resealable container. Shake or stir to mix; make sure all honey is dissolved. Place in freezer for at least 4 and up to 10 hours.
When ready to serve, add mezcal mixture and ice to a blender. Blend until uniform and pour into 2 glasses. Garnish each glass with half a lime wheel, if desired, and serve immediately.
